forkee.name: highlight
forkee.description: highlight.io: The open source, full-stack monitoring platform. Error monitoring, session replay, logging, distributed tracing, and more.

issue.title: Highlight Separate Chunks in one Step in the same screen
issue.body: I have different elements in a single screen that I want to highlight in a single steps in the tour. Now these elements do not share a single parent element (If they did I would have highlighted the whole parent element). How can I do highlight separate elements in a single screen?

issue.title: Highlight Separate Chunks in one Step in the same screen
issue.body: I have different elements in a single screen that I want to highlight in a single steps in the tour. Now these elements do not share a single parent element (If they did I would have highlighted the whole parent element). How can I do highlight separate elements in a single screen?

comment.body: This is not currently possible and there are no plans to add this.

issue.title: Popover direction issue
issue.body: Hi there, I was trying to implement a tour and facing an issue. The placement is fine, the issue is the blue border box. When I change or come to a step, the popup part always comes flying from top. Ideally if I were having 3 elements at flex row and wanted to show them one by one, the popup should be moving sideways instead. I read the docs but couldn't find anything relevant. Please help

issue.title: Popover direction issue
issue.body: Hi there, I was trying to implement a tour and facing an issue. The placement is fine, the issue is the blue border box. When I change or come to a step, the popup part always comes flying from top. Ideally if I were having 3 elements at flex row and wanted to show them one by one, the popup should be moving sideways instead. I read the docs but couldn't find anything relevant. Please help

comment.body: I am unable to reproduce this. Please submit a codesandbox link with the reproducing example.

issue.title: Allow Overlay Freezing/Prevent Dismiss on Overlay click
issue.body: Currently the overlay click only supports `nextStep` and `close`. I would like a capability of preventing the dismissal of the overlay on click.

comment.body:
Resolved in 1.4.0
You can now achieve this by passing a hook to `overlayClickBehavior`

issue.title: Allow Overlay Freezing/Prevent Dismiss on Overlay click
issue.body: Currently the overlay click only supports `nextStep` and `close`. I would like a capability of preventing the dismissal of the overlay on click.

issue.title: NPM course. From fundamentlas to mastery
issue.body:
Hi, 

I have been working on this course to master node.js' NPM. It has beginner-friendly structure. It has modules (content to be learnt), hands on exercises for each module (practical guides to test what you learn in each module) and examples (a section with different examples to experiment and keep learning). It is also open source, so people can contribute their own code or improve the existing content of the course.

# Table of contents

### Part 1: Foundations
- **Module 1: NPM Fundamentals** - Understanding NPM, installation, and configuration
- **Module 2: Package.json Deep Dive** - Mastering the heart of every Node project
- **Module 3: Installing Packages** - Dependencies, dev dependencies, and global packages
- **Module 4: Semantic Versioning** - Understanding version numbers and ranges
- **Module 5: Package-lock.json** - Ensuring deterministic installations

### Part 2: Daily Development
- **Module 6: NPM Scripts** - Automating tasks and workflows
- **Module 7: Managing Packages** - Updating, removing, and viewing packages
- **Module 8: NPM Cache** - Understanding and managing the cache
- **Module 9: Security & Auditing** - Keeping your projects secure

### Part 3: Advanced Topics
- **Module 10: Publishing Packages** - Share your code with the world
- **Module 11: Advanced NPM Features** - Workspaces, npx, and npm link
- **Module 12: Troubleshooting & Best Practices** - Common issues and professional workflows

### Part 4: Real-World Application
- **Module 13: Real-World Project** - Building a complete REST API
- **Module 14: CI/CD with NPM** - Integrating NPM into your deployment pipeline
- **Module 15: Final Project** - Create and publish your own package

comment.body: Thank you for the PR but self promotion is not allowed.

issue.title: Add Hindi translation for readme (readme.hi.md)
issue.body:
This PR adds a Hindi translation for the main README file.
- Added README.hi.md
- Kept original formatting and links

comment.body: Thanks but no, there is no need for that.

issue.title: feat: add new C# developer roadmap
issue.body:
feat: add new C# developer roadmap

### Summary
This PR introduces a new **C# Developer Roadmap** to the project, aligned with the existing roadmap structure and formatting standards.

### Added
- `/src/data/roadmaps/csharp/csharp.json`
- `/src/data/roadmaps/csharp/csharp.md`
- `/src/data/roadmaps/csharp/faqs-csharp.astro`
- `/src/data/roadmaps/csharp/migration-mapping-csharp.json`

### Notes
- No existing files were modified or removed
- Follows the current folder-based auto-registration system (no index update required)
- Matches structure and conventions used in the Java roadmap
- All content is self-contained and ready for future UI rendering

### Motivation
C# remains one of the most widely-used languages for backend, cloud, desktop, and game development. Adding this roadmap will benefit developers looking for structured guidance within the .NET ecosystem.

### Checklist
- [x] Files placed in correct directory
- [x] Naming follows roadmap standards
- [x] No breaking changes introduced
- [x] Content follows neutral and educational tone

comment.body: Thanks for the PR but please take a look at the contribution docs for roadmap submission.
